Shapeshifting - the wizard can take on the form of any creature. In this form, the wizard cannot cast any of his magic except the spell to resume human form but gains access to any of the abilities, traits, or spells the new form naturally possesses.
All wizards carry a distinctive trademark that is carried throughout their forms, which can take many forms, such as a birthmark, a certain eye colour or their human voice. Whatever its nature, the removal of this trademark will result in the wizard becoming trapped in the form. Other modifications to a form, such as the fitting of horseshoes, piercings, or wounds may also hamper the ability to transform.
In additionally, a wizard cannot shift back if their immediate surroundings are insufficient to accommodate their human body.
A wizard is vulnerable to familiarization as an animal, as well as any other spell that specifically targets any form.
Hive mind - a jade order wizard may transform into a group of animals, such as a flock of birds or swarm of ants. Maintaining their human identity is challenging, becoming more difficult in relations to the number of animals involved.

Toll
As their Toll progresses, Jade Order wizards grow distant to human affairs and closer to nature. They spend longer and longer periods in their animal or plant forms. Ultimately, the distinguishing trademark that each wizard carries between forms disappears, marking the point when the human form and mind is irretrievably lost.

College
The Jade College is built on the very outskirts of Sentral, situated on top of the catacombs that make up the Grey College, and the two Orders share a mutual understanding for each other. It is built of blocks of rough, unfinished stone held together be the thick vines that cover every inch of the walls. It is a sprawling, airy complex possessing many courtyards, orchards, arboretums, and aviaries.
155332212111.title: The Jade Order

1553322121111.content:
Fleshcrafting - the wizard can sculpt flesh. Beneath the touch of their fingers it becomes soft and malleable like wet clay and can be shaped into any design the wizard wishes. It is often used to remodel faces or to seal wounds, but with the addition of bone bending a talented Grey Order wizard may remake an organism into practically any shape. Certain eccentric wizards have even been known to make items of furniture out of the bodies of their still-living enemies.
The process of fleshcrafting is painful, slower and more involved than most other forms of shapeshifting but comes with a significant benefit in that it does not block a wizard's power in their new form. In essence, the wizard is still a wizard, he merely looks different.
Flay - the wizard tears away the skin of creature or humanoid as easily as peeling a banana. It is a horrific sight when being employed offensively but has a surprising beneficial use in the removal of skinsuit parasites from a host.
Animate corpse - the corpse of any victim killed by the wizard may be bestowed with a semblance of life and will serve the wizard unwaveringly.
Life siphon - drains the life energy of a target, aging them and reinvigorating the wizard. If used too long, the target becomes a walking corpse.

Toll
The toll of the grey wizard is particularly unpleasant. With its progression, the warmth of life slowly seeps from their bodies. Gradually they take on the appearance of a walking corpse, though the effects of this can be hidden for a time with fleshcrafting.
The mental deterioration cannot be so disguised. The wizard develops an insatiable need to feel the warmth of life once again. This may express itself in various ways.
Cannibalism - the wizard craves consuming fresh human flesh.
Hematophagy - the wizard drains the lifeblood of other creatures into themselves.
Organ/limb grafting - the wizard begins to graft healthy body parts into/onto their dying bodies
Nymphomania - the mere touch of warm flesh against their own is enough to satisfy their cravings

Eventually, the toll progresses to the stage where the wizard's blood clots in the veins and the flesh rots on the bones. The wizard is usually humanely killed at this point, their body completely incinerated to ensure they do not linger on in undeath.

College
The deep catacombs that lie beneath the Jade College along with the tunnels that run beneath Sentral make up the Grey College.
1553322121111.title: The Grey Order

15533221211111.content:
Study the Lore of Souls. Capable of manipulating the very minds of beings - befuddling them, changing them, even extracting them entirely. Light wizards can move souls from one body or vessel to another, and as they age the most powerful of their Order are awarded the honour of transferring their souls to a younger body.
Are exceptionally dangerous and deceptive, but regarded favourably among the common folk simply because they wear robes of pure white and often cast illusions of great beauty on themselves.

Spells
Befuddle - disorients a target
Blind - temporarily blinds a target.
Illusion - like elven glamour, a light wizard can produce an illusion. Depending on the competence of the caster, the illusion may move, speak, smell, taste, or even feel real. At higher ability levels, the caster can conjure false memories directly into a target's head.
Impel - by drawing or tattooing a command on a subject's body, the subject is forced to obey it to the letter.
Sculpt sound - you change the sounds that creatures or objects make. You can create sounds where none exist, deaden sounds, or transform sounds into other sounds.
Mind scan - the wizard peels away a target's mind, allowing them to peer at the memories and thoughts inside. Exquisitely painful to endure.
Mind wipe - empties a targets head of all memories, personality, and knowledge. If the mind has been previous backed-up on a soulstone, the memories and personality can be reinserted, otherwise they are permanently lost. Alternatively, the void can be filled with new memories or a new soul without fear of rejection.
Possession - the wizard turns into vapour and may enter a body to take control of it. The wizard does not have access to his magic while in this body but can use any abilities their host might have and read their memories.
Transmute soul - a target's soul leaves the body and is transformed into a wild animal. If the target does not recapture their soul within 24 hours, they die.
Living ghost - the wizard may create a soul-copy of an individual, complete with the original's memories and personality. The artificial soul may even believe they are the original. Requires a soulstone, onto which the copy is stored.
Soul jump - the wizard's soul jumps into a new body, forcing that soul to jump into his. This connection of the souls to their new bodies is tenuous at best and may reset at any time unless one of the bodies is killed or one of the souls is indoctrinated into accepting its new home. Additionally, a wizard does not carry over their powers of wizardry into the new body, not even the power of soul jumping, and so are at danger of becoming stranded in a body not their own. As such, this spell is usually only used as a measure of last resort.
Soul transfer - using a secret, unholy ritual, a dying wizard can be transferred permanently into a new body. Importantly, the wizard is able to carry over their magic into this new body, while gaining any abilities the new form has and shedding any toll in the process. Has the potential to create a wizard of a non-human race or amplify the powers of an existing wizard should they transfer into a body that is already a wizard.
The new body's original soul is destroyed in the process.
This ritual is reserved only for the most powerful of the Light Order hierarchy. There is evidence that the current Light Magi has been repeatedly stealing the bodies of his successors for many hundreds of years.

Toll
The wizard's physical form fades away, until only their spiritual essence remains. As the toll progresses and their hold on the physical world weakens, their attunement with magic increases but so does their vulnerability to obsidian. Light order wizards risk being drained inside obsidian or other soul-catchers, their soul trapped inside the rock forever in an existence worse than death. To protect themselves against this, a Light wizard will often attempt to secure themselves to the physical world by binding their soul to an item, animal, or human, or transferring it entirely to a new host.

College
15533221211111.title: The Light Order

155332212111111.content:
The Obsidian Order is not an Order of Magic; quite the opposite in fact. Though little is known for certain, it is an organization, possibly a cult, the purpose of which appears to be keeping magic in check. Whether this is a goal in and of itself or hints at some further, hidden goal is unclear.

They are responsible for the creation of Witchhunters, individuals whose bodies have been surgically augmented with obsidian weaponry and in parts replaced with clockwork prosthesis that give them supernatural strength, endurance, and agility. They are able to "smell" fresh magic, giving them the ability to hunt down and kill rogue magic-users, which they do with a relentless, almost-religious zeal.
Witchhunters are (on the face of things) for hire, selling their services to organizations and individuals freely. Ultimately however they owe their allegiance only to their master, the unseen head of the Obsidian Order.

In addition to the Witchhunters are the Obsidian Creatures, named so vaguely because nobody can quite figure out what animal they used to be. They are heavily augmented quadrupeds resembling a deformed dog with the skeleton partly exposed, and teeth and claws replaced with metal blades. Their hide is not that of a dog however, and they show intelligence beyond a mere animal.
155332212111111.title: The Obsidian Order

1553322122.content:
Work in progress

Crimson Order
Lair - A hidden place where crimson practitioners can replenish their essence and practice their craft. Subterranean, illuminated by ever-burning chunks of brimstone,
Flesh loom - There is a flesh loom at the heart of every lair. It's an ornate round basin set into the ground. Cloudy water laps at the rim. After making an offering of essence and writing their wishes in the demon tongue, the supplicant lowers their body into the pool, where great clawed hands unravel its form. Weak mortals are sometimes overwhelmed by the unearthly sensations, lose their grip, plunge into the depths and are incorporated into the loom's hideous crafts.

Golden Order
Philosopher's Stones - Three in existence. The stones are the mortal remains of the three greatest gold wizards to ever live. They will transmute anything that contacts them into pure gold. This transmutation is irreversible and undetectable, and the forgery is perfect, which differs from all other means of gold transmutation, which will invariably revert after a few hours.
The stone's will augment a gold order wizard's power five- fold and are the order's items of office, wielded only by the magi. Since their theft by Goblins, the power of the gold order has been greatly diminished.

Jade Order

Grey Order

Light Order
Soulstones - refined, purified obsidian. These chunks of translucent, pearly rock can hold a soul and, unlike unpurified obsidian, release it again. Once inside a soulstone, a soul may be given a new body to inhabit or used as a source of power.
1553322122.title: Five Order Artifacts and Items

155332213.content:
An interesting trait often found among the high nobility and old Houses of Tryzantium (and a number of other human, feudal nations) is the so-called 'blue blood' that runs though their veins, said to bestow a whole host of traits ranging from fine manners to intelligence, but most importantly the divine right-to-rule over the so-called red-blooded, peasant classes. As an inheritable trait, it has been intentionally and extensively cultivated by royal families for thousands of years through selective intermarriage within royal lines, and the cutting out of inheritance of titles to those waywards who debase their bloodline via marriage with the lower classes.

Acquiring and distilling this noble trait into ones bloodline takes generations yet can be greatly diluted within even a single generation, thus most nobles will risk a marriage to a lower class only if the benefits greatly outweigh the costs, such as if the partner is vastly wealthy or (in the most rare and scandalous cases) where the two are in so-called "love". Many wealthy merchant families have bankrupted themselves attempting to obtain noble marriage partners for, while titles may be bought or bestowed for the right price, only the blood secures the family's authority for generations to come.

The term 'blue blood' is a misnomer - even the king himself does not actually bleed sky-blue humors. Even at its most potent among the most inbred highborn families, it is no more than a mild blue tinge that colours the blood a shade similar to tyrian purple, and determining the presence let alone the level of blue-bloodedness is often a task requiring skilled hematologists . Also important to note is that every investigation undertaken by the Colleges so far has demonstrated that the trait offers no more discernible, practical benefit than, for example, having green eyes or big ears. Even still, it is revered by the poor, highly sought after by arcanists for use as spell-components and many of the most powerful royal heirlooms are keyed to only be wielded by somebody with blue blood.

A number of treatments are capable of masking or faking the trait. A tonic of certain metals will grant the appearance of blue blood, though it must be taken regularly and carefully, as the ingredients are all highly toxic. A number of elixirs will also eradicate the trait, some even permanently. In addition, a squalid lifestyle - malnutrition, base living conditions and hard, outdoor labour - will cause the trait to dwindle rapidly until it becomes that of an everyday serf, for reasons not yet understood.

As an addendum and minor curiousity, the reverse is true for the strange humans Versiland, who have naturally occurring 'blue blood' and red-blooded royalty.
155332213.title: Noble blood

1553322131.content:
Even though Trzantium have kings who rule politically it is actually the church that enforces the laws of the land. As such there are men who feel like the church is promoting male oppression. The church dismisses such claims and insists on the promotion of all that is female.

More about the church: Every Saturday the priestesses gather to offer the Goddess special sacrifices. The Mother Supreme acts in a similar manner as an Ordanian king would and enforces spiritual law. If the Queen of Tryzantium is a devout follower of the Goddess Carmen then she may act as the Mother Supreme herself until the church can vote on who will assume the position. Rarely does the Tryzantium queen get voted into the position permanently, but it does happen every 1000 years though. It is also said that some of the religious practices are identical to those who worship Ordin.

Festivals: Every year there are festivals to celebrate the coming of spring and winter. During such times the church or king are free to invite whoever they wish to Tryzantium. More often than not Tryzantium kings use this opportunity to attract suitors for marriageable sons and daughters. Besides the yearly festivals, the rulers of Tryzantium often hold special festivals of coronation. Here it is said that the royal family and the country celebrate as their new king gets crowned.

War: Ever since its birth Tryzantium has always been at war. It is even said that history repeats itself every 1000 years as a completely corrupt king assumes the throne. This king may desire eternal youth, godlike power, or complete control of the world. Whatever may be the case such a king is either usurped by a noble or is brutally killed off by his own children who are fed up with his corruption. Many in Tryzantium are quick to forget the dark history of their country and how the church and the nobility clash on many occaisions.
1553322131.title: Other facts about Tryzantium

15533221311.content:
The Swan Orthodoxy: The elders of the church believe that the swan is a sacred symbol of the Goddess's strength and beauty. In times of disaster seeing a swan was considered a sign of good luck. Priestesses and devout followers would often make pilgrimages to find the fabled Swan Lake. Many who embark on this journey sacrifice there lives by fighting all those who are enemies of the Goddess. Those that reach the lake live in peace where they can admire the swans and observe their sacred elegance.

Swanstress: A highly devout group taken from the Swan Orthodoxy. These priestesses go into battle singing sacred songs to encourage their allies. Their Swan Song also kills their enemies by causing a bombardment of sacred energy to fall from the heavens. Very few survive the deadly Swan Song. If they survive there is a high chance that they will live their days as Swans.

Sect of Reconciliation: The followers of Reconciliation seek to orchestrate the reunion of Camenae and Ordin. To this end they "accidentally" schedule Her holy festivals to coincide with those of Ordin, sabotage His relationships with the other gods and goddesses wherever possible, and steal His divine relics in hope that He will have to call round to Camenae's place one day to pick them up.

Sect of Moving On: The followers of Moving On seek to help the Goddess to move on from her lost love. To this end they scour the world in search of the perfect man for her to fall back on.

*sidenote: In the polytheistic nation of Erolus there are a small number from the Sect of Reconciliation and the Brotherhood Sect of the Reunion who believe that both Ordin and Camenae must die and be reincarnated in order for true union to occur. This secret sect of reincarnation is often frowned down upon by followers of Ordin and of the Goddess.
15533221311.title: Forms of Worship

1553322132.content:
Here are some other facts about the world.

Divine Blood: More valuable than Noble blood is Divine Blood. Divine Blood courses through the veins of gods, demigods, angels, and surprisingly demons. Though they have the same type of blood there are unique characteristics that be used to distinguish the blood from the different carriers of Divine Blood. There are four grades of Divine Blood with the grade occurring in the gods being the highest. Many corrupt rulers desire this blood in hopes of achieving immortality themselves. As learned from the Tyrians killing a god for his blood or to study his powers is a serious taboo followed by a nasty curse.

Noblelization: Noblelization is the process which a serf or commoner undergoes to turn their blood "blue" without faking the trait. Noblelization is a long process, but it is the safest way for a non-noble to achieve blue blood in order to become a noble. The most common way that occurs in Tryzantium, Ordania, Erolus, and other kingdoms is knighthood. For reasons unknown a commoner who manages to become a knight quickly gains this desirable trait. Also a healthy lifestyle and superb living conditions can cause the trait to appear as well. In Bishan the professions of monster taming and sumo wrestling also produce this trait. This is why many nobles in Bishan are top ranking sumo wrestlers or expert monster tamers. The last way is through clerical activity. Clerical activity is the slowest way to receive the trait for Noble blood.

Abandoned Ruins: There are several abandoned ruins in the world and many of them contain powerful artifacts. Upon entering a ruins those that explore the ruins must be prepared for a life altering encounter. The most famous is the Temple of Lost Seasons. Those that enter the temple usually don't come out the same.

Alternate Dimensions and Parallel Universes: When it comes to alternate dimensions it is accepted by all magic practitioners. These dimensions are where gods, djinns, demons, and other worldly creatures dwell. Parallel Universes are a tougher thing to explain. Erolusian monarchs claim that they exist due to their extreme psychosis and constant habit of breaking the fourth wall, but other people in the world scoff at the idea. The only other people to know about alternate realities are Blorogons and djinns.
1553322132.title: Other facts about the world

15533222.content:
High elves make their homes in breathtaking treetop cities cut and woven into the boughs of the trees that grow massive under their tending. They claim many forests as their own, including those in human lands, so the two races share an uneasy co-existence. Each forest is an independent realm, ruled over by its own king, queen, and their court.

Elves are arrogant and aloof, though perhaps deservingly so, as they are immortal, invariably beautiful and gifted both in martial prowess and magic. Their belief in their own perfection makes them cruel and callous in regard to all other races, and they guard themselves violently against outside influences that might tarnish their perfection. Despite its refinement, or indeed because of it, their culture is highly static and stagnant, as they have an innate racial fear of change. They would like nothing more than to sit in their lofty cities for the eternity their immortality affords, marveling in their own self-perfection.

The ascension of humanity has been an irritating challenge to their vision of supremacy ever since the first proto-humans fought the elves and pushed back the boundaries of their forests. The weakening of Tryzantium is the greatest opportunity in hundreds of years for the elves to launch their counter-attack.

Unless watched closely, Elven forests 'creep' ever outwards. Sometimes a particularly rapid expansion can engulf an entire human settlement in woodlands overnight, smothering its inhabitants in their beds with vines that grow and spread like tentacles. Anything caught in one of these expansion events becomes a part of the forest. These expansions have become more frequent in recent years as the High Elves push their luck against human defenses, and perpetuate the hostile wilderness that gnaws at Tryzantium from within.

High Elves have no gods. They worship only themselves.
15533222.title: High Elves

155332221.content:
Spells

Glamour
Casts an illusion over an object, person, or animal. Glamour can be used in a more general capacity to simply increase the desirability of a target without changing its appearance.

Artifacts

Face Book
A personal item of elves, a face book is a large, imitation-leather bound tome that will seal inside its pages the face of anyone who looks inside it. The reader may choose a new face from one of the others that adorn each page.
While mostly used as a cosmetic item, face books are sometimes used by jealous elves to steal the faces of beautiful mortals.

Glaive of Groves
An ancient druidic weapon, a Glaive of Groves lies at the heart of all elven forests. These enchanted items are the engines that drive the rapid expansion of elven forests.
If wielded, these Glaives are capable of transforming anything into any manner of wildlife. In the hands of a Jade Wizard, these weapons augment their power five-fold.
155332221.title: Elves: Magic users, spells, and artifacts

155332222.content:
Everything in this world comes at a price and immortality is no exception. For the High Elves that price comes in the form of degradation. Every hundred years or so of their lives, an individual High Elf will spontaneously undergo a change, a mutation that warps their body or mind until what emerges is no longer a High Elf but something new, one of potentially thousands of flavours of elf, each more troublesome than the last. Additionally a degradation can be induced if an elf is brought to near death.

For our first example, I present the degenerated clade known as the Night Elf. Notice the altered pigmentation of the skin and the eyes that glow with a lunar radiance. This variant is nocturnal, half-feral and lives mostly on the ground or even within in, inside dens built into the roots of trees. They dress in furs and they are extremely territorial, even by elvish standards, yet as long as you respect that they are actually more amenable to outsiders than High Elves. So you can see, not every degradation is bad, at least from the perspective of the Order.

http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_rUosuk--A9s/TR...

Now, while this degradation may be relatively mild, others leave them barely recognisable and completely insane. The poster child for this, the Drow variant are habitual torturers and rapists with no exception. White hair, black or purple skin, seen here. Kill on sight.

http://orig04.deviantart.net/64b6/f/2014...

Given enough time and the appropriate treatment, these changes can be reverted. The High Elves invest much of their energies to containing and reverting their mutated brethren, for all are an affront to their perfection by their mere existence. They purge the degradation, or put them down if this fails.

Now I could go on all day listing elvens subtypes because there are hundreds, and new variants pop up faster than the Jade Order can document them - but certain ones are common enough that at some point in the past they have gathered together in sufficient numbers to reproduce, forming stable, divergent populations of that elven subspecies. The High Elves generally hate these wayward splinters of elvenkind, and vice versa, which is great for us because we don't much like the High Elves either.

So today we're just going to go over the most common variants. Tomorrow we'll have a look at some of the rarer ones. In the exam you will be expected to identify samples of these creatures and know how to combat them, so do pay attention.

Wood Elves
One of the most friendly of degradations to humanity. The pale skin of the High Elf darkens to a nutty brown, and the elf will descend from the treetop cities to dwell on the forest floor where they seek to become one with nature.

Night Elves
Similar to Wood Elves, except nocturnal and more aggressive. Adopt a matriarchal society where the females hunt and govern, and the males meditate and worship the moon and the spirits.

Drow
Once again, a matriarchal society. Males are treated little better than slaves. The Drow are fortunately rare on the surface. On occasion they send hunting parties from their underground cities to capture surface dwellers as slaves.

Vorelves
A deeply degraded offshoot, Vorelves resemble their elven forebears only from the waist up, possessive serpentile tails in place of legs. They live in underground warrens, rarely seeing the sun except when they come up to hunt, and their skin is a pale yellow - like a maggot's - as a result. They number in their millions, and perhaps represent the greatest threat to mankind should they ever emerge en masse.

They take a sadistic pleasure in hunt and consume only sentient beings. For this purpose, their jaws can unhinge and their bellies swell, allowing them to eat their prey hole. Where this is not enough, their saliva has the effect of shrinking organic matter, allowing them to make mere bite-sized morsels out of larger prey. While their corruption has robbed them of much of their elven heritage, some are still capable of disguising themselves with glamour and walk the world above unseen.

They employ creations known as Bronze Hatcheries to contain and farm their prey. These labyrinths, composed of tightly coiled bronze pipe around a handspan in diameter, remind some of giant brains, though they may be any shape and range in size from just a few coils to the size of a room. Inside, they are are complex mazes which keep their tiny inhabitants in comfort and indulgence. Just lick 'em and pop 'em in the entry hatch! Mosses and fungi, both delicious and a potent aphrodisiac, grow on the wall, guaranteeing the hatchery's vorelf owners an endless supply of plump, juicy prey "on tap". Sections can also be sealed off and rendered far less pleasant, for the aspiring sadistic god.

Time passes more quickly on the inside of the hatchery, and while the vorelves lounge in torporous slumber, millenia have passed within. What current conditions are like inside the hatcheries is unknown.

Deviants are elves whose minds have cracked from the intense boredom that only immortality can offer. Hungry to experience something of novelty, they leave their forests to hunt out the new, the strange, and the exotic. They revel in highs and lows of emotion. They abandon the High Elves' notion that immortality must be closely cosseted, instead throwing themselves into danger solely for the thrill. Living amongst the other races, they relish foreign cultures. Life outside of the shaded forests has a notable effect on the pigmentation of their fair skin, turning it to shades of dark blue or purple, and their golden hair to silver.
155332222.title: Elven Degradations

1553322222.content:
Fey live alongside and are close allies of elves. An elusive and mysterious race of ethereal, child-like beings, they act seemingly without motive or logic. Have an innate talent for warping the laws of time, and a mischievous bent in using it. Those who tangle with the Fey by straying into their forests or tampering with fey artifacts may find themselves aged into withered husks, reduced to helpless infants, or cast backwards or forwards in time.

As such, their artifacts and influence is as desired by the old and dying as it is feared by the youthful.
1553322222.title: Fey

15533222222.content:
Muscular humanoids with bright green skin and flesh, Orcs hail from the Northern Wastes, an unforgiving expanse of tundra and swamp.

They epitomize mob-mentality - it is in fact built into their physiology. A lone Orc cay be rational, calm, even courteous, but put two together and this all changes. Each Orc emits pheromones that dull the intelligence and raises the strength and irritability of all others in its vicinity. This effect is cumulative. A rule of thumb is that for each additional Orc in a room, deduct 10 IQ points (with no lower threshold), and double their strength. The presence of a female Orc will further compound the situation by turning the male Orcs' aggression towards each other.

The Orc mind is a simple thing; they believe that size is everything. They will always attack if they have greater numbers. They always go for the biggest sword or heaviest axe. Their war chiefs are selected based on who is the strongest or simply the largest. Since Orcs appear to have no natural upper limit on their height or girth except what they can support in food (given a large enough supply of food an Orc could reach the size of a castle), and combined with their penchant for body modification, this has led to war chiefs of truly staggering proportions.

Orcs have an instinctive capacity for fleshcrafting, which they use to embiggen, empower and modify their own bodies, and shrink, weaken and mutilate their enemies. They are durable to the extent that they can, and frequently do, work armour and weapons directly into their flesh, turning themselves into living mechanical weapons. War chiefs, growing ever larger and constantly augmenting themselves, eventually begin to resemble vehicles or siege weaponry more than humanoids.

Jealous of humanity's advanced grasp of magic, the Orcs recently made an attempt to gather together their greatest magical minds in an attempt to forge their own College. In light of the fact that Orcs grow stupider when gathered together, this was one of the most foolish undertakings in history. The resultant explosion tore open portals the length and breadth of their territory, infesting their lands with demons, against which the Orcs now fight an endless battle. Many Orcs now do what was once unthinkable to them - they flee. Pushed out of their own lands, they encroach on human lands. A few have even succeeded in settling peacefully in human towns.
15533222222.title: Orcs

155332222221.content:
Curses
Ouroboros gut
A rather unpleasant affliction, the Ouroboros Gut curse causes the intestines to fold back on themselves like a snake eating its tail. The cursed individual develops insatiable hunger, will consume anything available, and will grow larger and more voracious in direct proportion to the amount they eat.
An Orc may use this spell on a captured enemy before releasing them, in the knowledge that the cursed individual will return to their own side and, if left unchecked, consume the entire food supply. The individual will continue to grow until they explode.

Bloodlust
Orcs have the ability to take an opponent's battle fury and turn it into avarice, gluttony, sloth, or sexual lust. They take particular enjoyment using this on human Paladins and other warriors of the Church.

Items
Orc Fetishes
Small carvings made of wood or stone that Orcs carry with them. Often enchanted, and serve many purposes. May be mementos of a hunt, or lucky charms. Many grant enhanced strength or size to their owner. Some are fertility symbols, crudely depicting men and women of highly endowed proportions.
It is unwise to touch Orc fetishes without gloves as the human body is often not suited to cope with the stat bonuses these items bestow.
155332222221.title: Orcs: Magic-users, spells and curses

155332222222.content:
The warrior women known as the Amazons are all that remain of the once grand Kingdom of Horr, a human realm of men and women that sat upon the peninsula that juts into the sea west of Tryzantium. A population of fishermen and farmers, when an army of Orcs threatened their lands they were powerless to stop them. Overwhelmed and with their king dead, his wicked advisor ventured into the sealed catacombs beneath the city, retrieved a forbidden demon artifact and called forth a Succubus Queen with whom he forged an diabolical pact.

The resulting explosion shattered the peninsula into a broken archipeligo and transformed every Horrian male - man and boy - into half-succubi warrior women, who forced back the green Orcish tide. Having secured what remained of their lands, they proceeded to cast out the Horrian women who had been untouched by the demon's spell. Renaming themselves Amazons, they now strive to rebuild their shattered lands and their numbers for a counter-offensive against the Orcs.

Amazons reproduce by the seduction or rape of other races; during intercourse, their partner is sucked into the Amazon's body and undergoes a unholy metamorphosis within the womb, turning them into a fellow Amazon. Upon being rebirth, they are tortured until their mind are broken before being indoctrinated to be more Amazonian. Only the strongest enemy soldiers are chosen to become Amazons and they are ironically sexist about it, chosing only men, regarding women as too frail and soft to join their number.

Despite their unnatural methods of reproduction, a rogue group of Amazons have recently begun experimenting with such concepts as 'femininity' and 'motherhood', though as Amazons still retain much of their formerly male minds, they tend to suck at it. To explore these alien concepts, they trap captives into child or baby-like forms during the rebirth process, and mother the transformed captive in lieu of the children they are unable to bear themselves. Given the Amazons' rather skewed perception of motherhood and their total lack of maternal instincts, it is unclear if death is the more desirable outcome.
155332222222.title: Amazons

1553322222221.content:
Magic users

Spells

Artifacts

The Scepter of Horr
A relic of the lost civilization of Horr and the very scepter used to summon the succubus queen that cursed every male Horrians. The current location of the scepter is unknown but considering that it was at the very epicenter of the explosion that sank the peninsula, it could conceivably have landed anywhere.
Can summon and control demons, and manipulate reality. In the hands of a Crimson Wizard, augments their powers fivefold.
1553322222221.title: Amazonians: Magic users, spells and artifacts

1553322222222.content:
These nomadic, blue-green amphibians ply the rivers and waterways of the world, peddling their wares. Their only 'stable' territory is a vast ocean city made of lashed-together boats and barges, which moves constantly to avoid attack.

Goblins deal often in enchanted and cursed weapons and armour, as well as slaves of all kinds. They also enjoy a bustling black-market trade in body parts, buying and selling limbs and organs from their bodyshoppes.

Goblins possess the ability to regenerate from any non-mortal injury, and can grow back limbs over a period of a few days. Their bodies will always return to their natural state, even if grafted with limbs and organs from other races. Additionally, goblin limbs and organs grafted onto other species will spread over the entire body, eventually converting the transplantee into a goblin entirely. For this reason, goblin traders will often sell their own body parts for next to nothing, knowing that they themselves will regrow the part, while the person that receives it will have to pay to have further parts replaced as the goblinfection spreads through their body.

Beneath their damp, mottled skin lies a distinctively sadistic streak, born partly from their diminutive size compared to the other races. Many goblins revel in shrinking the larger races, often reducing clients down to their size or smaller before any business negotiations begin. Goblins also like nothing more than transforming would-be thieves into useful trinkets to be added to their collection.

Are literally ruled by money; laws are bought and sold on a daily basis by the richest merchants.

Racial Attributes
True sight - goblins can see through illusions and magical deception.
1553322222222.title: Goblins

15533222222221.content:
While goblins have scant magical talent, their ingenious inventions allow them to make up for this shortfall. The shrewd goblins also have the ability of Pure Sight, allowing them to see through magical trickery and illusions. If attempting to fool a goblin, magical means are rarely the surest option.

Body shoppes/Brawnbrokers/Organlegging
Do a lucrative trade in the purchase and sale of appendages and organs. Need money fast? Sell your redundant limbs. Want a pair of Orc arms? They can do that too. An Elvish face? Costly, but perfectly doable.

Goblin Knife
While appearing as nothing more than a short, dull blade, the characteristic Goblin Knife is both a deceptively formidable weapon and a master craftsman's tool. The blunt blade slices through flesh and bone like butter, leaving a clean, sealed cut. Any body part severed by the blade remains in good health and can be reattached to its owner or to anyone else.
Most Goblin traders own one of these knives for self-defense and to restock their Body Shoppes, often at the same time.

Dehydrated Muscles.
This powder is injected just below the skin. Normally inert, it expands when the owner drinks a large quantity of water, becoming a fully functional set of muscles which lasts for several hours. The quantity inserted makes a difference; some seek only a little extra tone, while others use the powder to become towering pillars of kill-meat.
It must be used with caution, as over several months the muscle will degrade into fat; regular exercise will trim this down as it forms, but more than one wanna-be Adonis or sculpted goddess has found themselves a pot of chub after neglecting to stay active. Sometimes the powder is intentionally used this way with spot injections in the chest or rear.

Golem
Mechanical constructs built to serve their masters. Come in thousands of configurations, from battle golems to servile or pleasure golems. Their construction can range from rudimentary automatons to near-human counterfeits.

Goblin Jumper Cables
Goblin jumper cables allow two souls to jump between bodies. Rare and require considerable energy to power.

Water cloak
Rare items of clothing magically woven from water. These liquid cloaks protect the amphibious Goblin merchants in dryer climates. Additionally, when pulled around the body, the refractive effect of the water produces an imperfect invisibility, camouflaging the wearer with the surroundings.

Mental floss
A length of psychotropic seaweed twisted into a thin thread. Goblins threads this plant between the ears of slaves - the seaweed grows into the brain, making the afflicted compliant and erasing memories and thoughts.

The Philosophers' Stones
In actually the physical remains of the three greatest Gold Order wizards ever to have lived, the three philosophers' stones are powerful relics. Once the items of office of the Gold Order Magus, before enterprising goblins stole them. The stones can transmute base metals into pure gold perfectly and permanently, and the transformation is undetectable from the real thing, even by Gold wizards.
As such, the goblin cabal that now owns them has the human economy by the balls. It is imperative to both the Kingdom and the Gold Order that they be returned.
A philosophers' stone in the hands of a Gold Order wizard will augment their power five-fold.
15533222222221.title: Goblins: Magic users, spells, and artifacts

choices: Shapeshifters: Magic users, spells, and artifacts
15533222222222.content:
A disparate, dwindling race, the changelings originate from a magically-unstable region deep within the eastern mountain range. They are distrusted by all other races for their ability to assume any shape. Outcasts seeking a place to belong and an identity to call their own, it is a sad fact that most will wind up as thieves, assassins, and whores.

In their natural form, shifters are pale humanoids, almost featureless and indistinguishable from each other, with the capacity to imitate. Juvenile changelings are limited in their abilities, able to make only superficial facial changes. At the onset of puberty, their flesh starts to soften so that by the time they reach maturity, their body has become like malleable rubber. At this stage, they can imitate individuals of other races almost perfectly.

Their condition progresses as they age, making them more unstable but allowing the changeling to take on first animal and finally inhuman, inanimate shapes. Ultimately their condition develops to the stage where the individual can no longer hold itself together and it degenerates into formless gunk.

These tragic slime creatures seek shelter in ruins and tombs, lest a strong rain dissipate their liquid bodies. Most eventually meet their death at the end of an adventurer's sword, or are collected and used as ingredients in potions.

A slime-ified changeling if ingested will grant the imbiber shapeshifting abilities for the length of time that the changeling remains in the guts, although be warned that the changeling will make rapidly for the "exit" and that you will be stuck in whatever form you're in once the changeling has left your system.
15533222222222.title: Changelings

choices: Anthros/Beastmen: Magic users, spells, and items
155332222222222.content:
Anthros, animen, manimals, beastmen, halfbreeds or furries - just a few of the terms that cover the uncountable breadth of human-animal hybrids. There are as many potential halfbreeds as there are species of beast in the world, encompassing such things as centaurs, werewolves, dogmen and catgirls. New variations are constantly spawning wherever humans, animals and magic are in close proximity, though certain mixes are common enough to have banded together and formed their own societies.

Though wild-born halfbreeds make up the bulk of their numbers, not all were born as they are. Some are beasts that gained a semblance of humanity through magical interference. Others are human-born, humans that have adopted (or had forced upon them) animal traits.

How anthros are treated by humans varies greatly depending on the species, the location, and whether or not they have an owner. Most larger towns are tolerant of feline, canine, and lizard men on the proviso that they don't cause trouble, though they are only afforded the rights of animals, not humans. If they have no owner, they can be killed without trial and anyone wishing to claim them can do so simply be catching, collaring, and branding/tattooing them. Life for a free anthro is a constant struggle to remain unclaimed.

As a middle-ground, anthros may surrender their ownership to a military, such as those of the Study or the Faith. While owned by these organizations they cannot be claimed by others and enjoy marginally more freedom compared to slaves owned by individuals. They are often used as scouts, front-line soldiers and in high-risk operations, and can even progress through the ranks and garner a modicum of prestige.

Out in the sticks, where wild anthro raids are common, any anthro not under the clear, direct control of a human will be treated as a dangerous animal and attacked on sight. The more dangerous types, such as werewolves, vampires, and centaur are not tolerated even in the liberal city of Sentral.

Felini
Cat-human fusions that are popular as slaves for their high docility and intelligence. The coverage of the fur varies between individuals, from coating just the tail and ears, to encompassing the whole body. They are commonly used as scouts for the agility and speed, and as concubines for their sensuous natures. Female felini go into heat roughly once a month.

Canids
Dog-humans fusions are frequently employed as slave labour for their endurance, strength and unwavering obedience.

Saluria
Lizard/human fusions, saluria are prized by the Study for their innate capacity to memorize and cast spells. Individual saluria can be taught around 4-6 simple spells and are often given into the ownership of battle wizards, assisting them in their duties.
As cold-blooded creatures, they become lethargic in cold weather and are constantly on the lookout for sources of heat, even if that means cuddling up with the closest warm-blooded creature. In hotter climates, saluria become aggressive, insubordinate or outright rebellious and are thus deployed appropriately to cooler climates where they can be more easily controlled. The one spell they are never taught is the fire spell, as giving them control over their own body temperature would simple be asking for trouble.
Saluria worship deities of fire and light.

Viera
Rabbit/human or rabbit/elf hybrids, the Viera are tall, with long ears and supple limbs. They breed prodigiously and the Kingdom is currently taking steps to limit their numbers.

Ponygirls and ponymen
An unsatisfactory result of an attempt at creating a more docile human-horse hybrid than the centaur, ponymen lack the hind quarters of the horse, having only equine hooves, mane, and ears. They are in most other respects human, unsuited for the strenuous manual labour they were designed for. This has not discouraged their owners forcing them into a harsh life of toil.

The Centaur
Body of a horse, head and torso of a man. They live in clans on the northern steppes and are in constant conflict with the human nomads, a war that spiraled out of a minor skirmish when the victorious humans coaxed their horses to mount the wives of the beaten centaur cheiftans. This obscene act united the clans forever against the humans.
They possess an aggressive, independent, and willful temperament and are rarely used as slaves, as most centaur will sooner kill themselves. Those that have been successfully tamed are seen as items of great esteem by their owners.

Werewolves
It is unclear specifically why, but wolf-human hybrids are invariably unstable creations, both mentally and physically. The wolf and human aspects fluctuate in dominance according to the waxing and waning of the moon and mentally the two aspects are constantly waring with the other, resulting in individuals who are tormented, violent, or insane.

Vampire/Vampyre/V'ḧmpęěr
One of the most ancient human-animal fusions, originally the vampire were nothing more than bat-human hybrids which drank blood. This all changed when the first proto-vampire fed on demon blood, imbuing his subsequent bloodline with a host of unholy powers and elevating them into a new, distinct race.
Vampires are creatures of darkness, able to shape-shift into a number of forms, even living shadows, but unable to walk in daylight and deadly vulnerable to fire. They are able to dominate lesser minds with a mere glance.
Vampirism peaked 450 years ago, attaining a domain that encompassed most of humanity. In those dark days, there were few villages that didn't fall under the shadow and predations of a vampiric baron, forced to pay homage in the form of delicious virgin women. However, their time in the sun (so to speak) did not last and hunted to "believed" extinction since then, they now exist as a fraction of their old numbers, hiding from the world, slowly rebuilding, plotting, and scheming.

Scrabs
Unpleasant, diminutive creatures a few feet in height, scrabs resembles a cross between a dung beetle and a tramp. They dwell in filth and love everything about it - the smell of it, the colour of it, the taste of it, rolling it up into balls, building little houses out of it.
They are tolerated solely because they are fundamental to the smooth running of a sewerage system, or taking the place of sewerage systems where none exist, collecting and squirreling away fecal matter to do... goodness knows what with it.
They have the greatest freedom of all anthros simply because no sane man would ever want to keep one as a slave or go anywhere near one.
155332222222222.title: Halfbreeds

1553322222222222.content:
The designation "demon" encapsulates all the myriad organisms that dwell within the parasitic netherworld that exists concurrent to ours - the "Hell dimension", if you will. Though study is hampered by the inhospitability of this realm to mortals, it would appear that demonkind is equally as varied as that of the mortal world, with species ranging from insects to sentient life of formidable intellect. The Demonology Department of the Crimson Order has studied and catalogued this infernal ecosystem for centuries, and shows no sign of completing their task any time soon.

Yet despite their seemingly endless variance, all demons share a number of characteristic - first and foremost, their need to feed upon the life essence of mortals. The crudest demons feed upon physical essences - often draining life-rich fluids such as blood. The more complex, intelligent demons favour more rarefied essences, and may be sustained by the consumption of the emotional and sensual energy produced by mortals in heightened mental states. To this end, these demons will seek to arouse intense feelings of terror, hatred, greed or lust from their prey, upon which they then feed.

The most powerful of their number, the Demon Lords, sustain themselves on pure spiritual essence - feasting on the soul itself. In terms of sheer power, the Demon Lords rank almost on par with mortal gods and have forged unbreakable contracts with them over the years. The Demon Lords do not directly interfere with the mortal world; in return, all sinful souls are banished to Hell to be fed upon for all eternity. The Demon Lords constantly seek to find loopholes in the contracts, tempting humans to fall into sin.

Studies suggest that all demons share a natural hierarchy, and will rise and fall depending on how well fed they are. A low ranking demon such as a lemure that feeds particularly well will grow and ultimately metamorphosise into a greater demon, such as an Erinyes, while even Demon Lords may be reduced to tiny Quasits if deprived of their hoard of souls for too long.

Once a mortal soul has been utterly drained of energy, it is cast aside and reborn as a demon on the lowest rung of the infernal food chain.

Being not of this world, demons are abominations against all natural and divine order, and as such their powers are diminished by natural or holy substances. A sword made of wood will do more damage to a demon than one made of iron, for example. Leather will negate demonfire better than steel armour. And for some strange reason, tree sap processed into rubber will bind a demon with ease. It is for this reason that demon summoners are naturally quite fond of leather and latex.

Demonkind

Succubus
Tiny horns, bat-like wings, and a sinuous tail betray the demonic nature of this alluring woman. A succubus drains energy from a mortal she lures into an act of passion.
Among the demon hordes, a succubus can often rise to incredible heights of power through her manipulations and sensual charms, and many a demonic war has raged due to the subtle machinations of such creatures.

Incubus
Like their succubi counterpart, incubi drain energy from a mortal lured (or forced) into an act of passion.
An incubus in his true form is always muscular and attractive, with long hair and intense eyes. His skin can be of any color, but is always smooth and silky. When not using his wings for flight, an incubus can fold them to drape across its shoulders like a cloak. They are also often conjured for similar roles by mortal spellcasters, although care must be taken in dalliances with incubi, for they delight in causing pain to their companions.

Salikotal
On lean limbs the color of spilt blood creeps a being of sinister grace. Eyes like embers and a sneer full of needle-thin teeth gleam from an unmistakably fiendish visage.
Often called the "Assassins of Hell" or the more sinister "Slayers of Souls". Despite ranking high in the infernal hierarchy, Salikotal still fall just short in their ability to consume a complete, whole mortal soul. thus upon dealing the fatal blow, the Salikotal will rip apart the soul of the victim itself. These soul fragments hide themselves in nearby vessels - animals or objects - or attach themselves to people, and are individually weak enough for the Salikotal to feed upon. The soul fragments will always be drawn to one another, wishing to be made whole again, and a Salikotal works feverishly to ensure this does not happen.

Patraavex
This fiend is a horrendous amalgamation of snapping claws and writhing tendrils with a disgusting fanged mouth running vertically across its torso.
Known as "Sire Demons", Patraavexes are the progenitors of many of the mortal realm's tieflings. Seeking mortals who either want hellspawn children or are willing to bear an infernal taint on their bloodlines in exchange for the demon's offerings, a sire demon lives to insinuate hell's influence into the mortal population. Patraavexes use their shapechanging ability as a bargaining chip with potential mates, who put their immediate pleasure above the long-lasting ramifications of corrupting their bloodlines with an infernal taint.

Belier
This amphisbaenic monstrosity has the body of a slug with a leech’s mouth at one end and a knot of three human heads at the other.Masterful possessors and foul manipulators, belier demons are among the most feared masterminds of Hell. These worm-like fiends avoid physical confrontation. Instead, they target influential individuals for possession, using them to manipulate events by proxy. If their schemes are uncovered, the demons retaliate with all the power at their host bodies’ disposal.
A bdellavritra’s voice can emanate from its worm-like maw, from any of its human-like mouths, or from all four at once, as it desires. Each mouth has its own distinct voice, often pleasing to the human ear. Bdellavritras typically reach lengths of 16 feet from worm-mouth to human heads, and weigh 3,000 pounds.

Lech - parasitic leech-like creatures that feed on a host's lust, suppressing sexual desires. The feeding of a lech produces a feeling of euphoria in its host. If a lech is not allowed to feed within 24 hours, sexual urges generally resurface stronger than before, along with symptoms of withdrawal. Since the introduction of female wizards, the magi have enforced the usage of leches by all wizards out of concern that the opposite sex poses a distraction in warfare.
Curiously, the lech also has the effect of suppressing the onset of adolescence in prepubescents, maintaining them in a child-like state.
1553322222222222.title: Demons

15533222222222222.content:
Once a race of stoic and resilient brawlers, these subterrean dwellers constructed glorious underground cities and feats of engineering unmatched by their overground contemporaries. Sadly, they are now nearly extinct - the majority of their population having been consumed by Vorelves. Their cities now swarm with the corrupted elves, their great achievements lying unguarded for any enterprising individual bold enough to venture underground.

The fact that the vorelves have entered as state of decades-long torpor as they digest the Dwarves tough, stone-like bodies is perhaps the only reason the corrupted elves have yet to attack the world above.

There are recorded instances of living dwarves being recovered from the stomachs of Vorelves, but they usually only stick around only long enough to grab an axe and be pointed in the direction of the nearest dwarven mine.
15533222222222222.title: Dwarves

155332222222222222.content:
Draconians
Over a thousand years ago, a band of humans desperate to stop the endless predations of dragons sought out the breeding ground of the dragon queen, destroying its clutch of unhatched dragons. In revenge, the dragon queen cursed the humans such that they and their descendants would forever play host to the souls of her butchered children and, over time, become their new bodies.

The half-human, half-dragon Draconians are the result of that curse. Though the children of Draconians are born essentially human, at the onset of puberty they develop wings and hard, metallic scales that spread across their body as they age. When fully formed, they are hot-blooded (to the point that their fresh blood will scald a human), fiery-tempered carnivores with voracious appetites and insatiable lusts for both treasure and maidens. They are ferocious, animalistic tendencies becoming more so as they develop. Ultimately, over many many years, a Draconian will lose their humanoid form altogether, becoming a true dragon.

Draconians periodically outgrow and shed their skins; garbing a human in these skins will give them the body of the draconian exactly as they were in that stage in their development, though will not afflict them with the curse.

They live in the frosty heights of the Rawridge Mountains, coming down from their seclusion to hunt.

The dragon queen retreated into mourning shortly after the destruction of her nest, not laying a single egg since that day; as such true dragons have vanished almost entirely from the world. However, the oldest Draconians, those surviving members of the original party of humans that destroyed the nest, have almost completed their slow transformation into full dragons and will soon become able to lay true dragon eggs of their own, ushering in a return to the reign of dragonkind.

True Dragons
Nigh-indestructable, highly destructive, fire-breathing, flying reptiles. Extremely dangerous, kill on sight.

Wyrmholes
Wyrmholes are magical tears in space and time that link areas many hundreds of miles apart. These portals lie along the migratory routes of the dragons; in the days of old they were formed by migrating dragons tearing through reality with their powerful magic.

After the fall of the dragons, the wyrmholes came under control of human wizards. They represent the safest, fastest method of travel over long distances, allowing wizards to be deployed anywhere in the world. Due to the nature of the holes, they are usually high in the sky, necessitating that the wizards build towers around them.

Wyrmholes fluctuate over a period of years according to the long-lost migratory paths and rhythms of the ancient dragons, becoming unstable or closing with little warning. Old wyrmholes may reactivate after periods of hundreds of years. The wyrmhole network is of paramount importance to the continued survival of Tryzantium and to keep it operational, the Colleges of magic constantly monitor the flow of energy -or leylines- that follows active holes and presages their collapse, and the Gold Order works hard to keep working the exotic machinery required to stabilise the tears long enough for somebody to jump through.
155332222222222222.title: Dragons and Draconians

1553322222222222221.content:
A short, inquisitive race of humanoids that lives around the world in isolated valleys, calderas, deep woods, or cavern systems--anywhere they can build their communities while remaining safe from the larger and more dangerous races. Their word from themselves is Gnomae, but they are more frequently known as bottle gnomes, a name given to them by human alchemists due to their curious metabolic traits. The bodies of gnomes are hypersensitive to the magical properties of the natural world, and will often draw out and express hidden alchemical properties in their food. Because of this, gnomes tend to express strange characteristics as they age, everything from growing antlers or tails to changing their color or size dramatically to acquiring bizarre powers and abilities.

Gnomes are often sought by those who seek to exploit this trait, stuffing them full of the proper ingredients and then extracting the result potion as it's produced. Female gnomes are preferred for this purpose, as they can be easily milked to produce a high-quality, nearly pure extract. Due to a pronounced gluttonous streak, gnomes may voluntarily participate in this endeavor if the ingredients are tasty.

Eating large quantities of ordinary potatoes will render a bottle gnome highly explosive; this is sometimes used in war. Understandably, there are few volunteers for this service.
1553322222222222221.title: Battle Gnomes

15533222222222222211.content:
Winged humanoids only a few inches in height with shiny skin of rubber. Their elastic bodies protect them from the rigors of life in miniature, where the threat of being crushed under foot, hoof or buttocks is a constant.

Pixies have massive appetites for their size and, despite appearing defenseless, when threatened they are quite capable of defending themselves, unhinging their flexible jaws and sucking down anything in the area, swelling themselves to match its opponent's size and generally sucking down their aggressor in the process. The aggressor becomes trapped inside the pixie, its strength added to its own until it deigns to release it.

Pixies seek to be on good terms with the humanoid races as creatures their size have many natural predators and settlements make safe havens. Pixies often act as messengers and couriers of small items in the human metropolises where the danger of wild animal attack is less. They still hate rats and cats with a passion however. Pixies are understandably concerned of being eaten because, although most animals are incapable of digesting them, it takes 7 years for them to pass through a digestive tract. This is not pleasant.

At a pinch, Pixies can be used by the larger races as effective albeit unwilling condoms. This is also not pleasant.
15533222222222222211.title: Pixies

155332222222222222111.content:
Homunculi are humanoids created through alchemy. They retain the characteristics derived from the remains that were used to create them. In this way Homunculi make excellent spies in times of war. However creating Homunculi is a forbidden practice in the art of alchemy. To create a Homunculus the alchemist must always have a live sacrifice when performing the ritual. If the alchemist is inexperienced or does not have a life to sacrifice, then they will forfeit their own life in order to create the Homunculus. When it comes to Homunculi they are nearly indestructible due to the unnatural way that they heal themselves. This novelty has made the idea of having a Homunculus as a servant a luxury for the extremely wealthy.

However. one should not underestimate a Homunculus. They are as crafty as the race that their remains are derived from. Some scholars claim that they have glimpses of their former lives. Yet unlike other humanoids they are incapable of reproducing naturally and thus must use alchemy to increase their numbers. With this being said it is also rumored that they don't age. Alchemists are baffled at the reason why Homunculi remain young. Some have theorized that they get their longevity from a dimension that borders the world itself. This has led the church to brand them as demons even though they are neither human nor demon. In recent years a small group of Homunculi have been secretly planning the downfall of humanity. These Homunculi claim that humans are an inferior race and must accept that the way of the Homunculi is the next step in the natural order. So the Homunculi slowly take over positions of power in the human lands and turn the nobles into Homunculi like themselves. Homunculi are tough to spot, but they always have an alchemy symbol for life somewhere on their body.
155332222222222222111.title: Homunculi

1553322222222222221111.content:
Chimeras are animals or humanoids who have been mutated through alchemy in order to create a new breed of creatures or super soldiers. Most chimeras have their DNA infused with various species. Therefore not all chimeras are the same. Chimeras made strictly from animals are often sold to royalty as exotic pets. Chimeras created from humanoids and animals retain some humanoid features, such as being bipedal and their speech, but they are solely used as soldiers and nothing else. Most of these humanoid chimeras are transformed against their will. They are usually treated as second class citizens in human society and treated as rejects by the church.

Recently their are rumors that various chimeras are planning on escaping and starting their own nation. For too long alchemists have taken away their rights by turning them into monsters in the first place. If they could run away and start their own nation, then they will have their desired freedoms again. Unlike Homunculi, Chimeras can naturally reproduce, but their children are usually born as chimeras and are often bullied by humans, homunculi, and the other humanoid races. Maybe when the time comes then the chimeras will strikeout on their own. But are chimeras ready to embark on a dangerous journey for independence?
1553322222222222221111.title: Chimeras

15533222222222222211112.content:
Hailing from the island Republic of Phoenice, Phoenicians (for the most part) resemble humans except from the knee down their legs become like the talons of a bird and from their should blades sprouts a large pair of wings covered in red and gold plumage. Their skin and feathers are hot to the touch and can be seen to glow slightly in darkness.

Phoenicians have a life cycle which mimics that of the phoenix. They live short lives, usually between 5-7 years, growing to maturity within the first year and deteriorating rapidly into old age as they enter their final months. Upon a natural death, the Phoenician bursts into flames and is reduced to a pile of ash. Nestled within the pile is a large egg, from which the Phoenician soon hatches, possessing the same memories, personality and soul but a new body.

In the event of a near-fatal disease, poisoning or trauma, the body will hastily attempt to gather the energy necessary to perform an emergency rekindle. Depending on the severity of the injury or disease, the rekindling may succeed, go awry (producing such curiousities as Phoenicians with the bodies of animals) or fail completely, with particularly violent deaths such as decapitation almost never succeeding. No matter the cause, if a rekindling approaches, the person will usually be made comfortable by their friends and family within a nest of dry wood and flammable material to assist in the process.

Fire does not burn them, only energising them with life force. Indeed sufficiently hot flames have the curious effect of turning back their body clock, making them appear years younger, if only for a short time. Strong spirits have the same effect, combusting internally, and it is highly recommended for anybody attempting to pick up a Phoenician to check that the person they take home from the bar at the end of the night is the same age as when they met earlier that evening.

Despite growing to physical maturity in a year, newborn Phoenicians are generally not regarded as adults until they have gone through two or three life cycles. It is common for youngsters to have their wings clipped to help parents control them better and to signal to others that this person is to be treated as a child.

Until only recently the Phoenicians were not a race, but a nation of humans, The Republic of Phoenice, which sits out in the warm, tranquil waters of the Hadriatic Sea upon the slopes of an island volcano. Within the volcanic caldera dwelt a phoenix to which the early human settlers of the island would make offerings as a means of appeasing what they took to be the mountain spirit. Over time these offerings became grander, ultimately spurring the formation of a grand maritime trading empire as they ventured further afield to find exotic gifts. Their merchantile fleet even began to rival the goblins flotillas.

All was going well until the cataclysmic shattering of the Kingdom of Horr. The earthquake triggered the eruption of the volcano, burying the capital of the republic beneath lava and ash. When the dust settled, the phoenix ventured down from the mountain to discover the bodies of the humans who had treated it so well over so long, sealed in molds of hardened ash.

Stricken by grief, the Phoenix sacrificed itself in a final death, imbuing its immortal flame into the bodies. The stone casts broke apart, birthing forth the first generation of a new race.

Since that day, they have worked to rebuild their destroyed republic with a fiery optimism. With the goblins now dominating the seas, the Phoenicians have turned to a new technology - airships.
15533222222222222211112.title: Phoenicians

155332222222222222111123.content:
Hobbits are a diminutive race of near-humans that live in small, close-knit communities distributed across all human lands, though favouring quiet rural areas. Their homes are built underground and can be found by the sight of windows and doors jutting from hillsides, though the sound of song and laughter is also a giveaway for this gentle race is fond of merriment, and can always be relied upon to provide a (admittedly cramped) room for the night to any traveler in exchange for a tale or two, and/or some mild cuckoldry.

If given the chance, hobbits will commit their lives to nothing more than light agriculture, the maintainence of their dens-homes (for they are fiercely houseproud), and the endless extension and stocking of their cellars with good foods, sweet wines and pipeweed. No hobbit town has ever progressed beyond simple cottage industry. They do not produce weapons or armour (though a hobbit with a rolling pin is a formidable thing should you ever insult his or her home) and have no army. They depend heavily on humans more protection from the worst the world has to offer and in exchange provide us with quality food and a little tax and don't cause any bother.

In appearance, hobbits stand around 4' tall with portly, paunchy figures.

They live up 200 years old and mature with their customary leisurely pace, reaching sexual maturity at around 40 years of age. The word 'hobbit' comes from the old hobbit language for 'whole person', which makes more sense once we look into their reproductive habits.

Hobbits have a strange quirk of biology in that any offspring born to a pairing of two hobbits will grow to a full height only half that of their parents, roughly two feet tall. These children they refer to as 'halflings'. The offspring of halflings will be half the size again, one foot tall, and termed 'quarterlings'. Beyond that we have eighthlings, sixteenthlings and so on and so forth, becoming vanishingly small with each generation. I do believe the smallest we ever found were in a very old, very remote hobbit town. Well I say town, it was more of an ant hill. Individuals found were less than a third of an inch tall, if you can believe that! And if you don't, we have plenty of preserved samples in archives. Whether this represents a lower limit of their size, we've yet to confirm.

Halflings are not only shorter but slimmer than their sedentary parents. Where hobbits are slow, halflings are nimble. While hobbits are flabby and soft, halflings have dense, muscular flesh that pound-for-pound make them stronger and durable to blunt force and crushing injuries, traits which become only more pronounced and more necessary for survival as they get smaller. They also become more flighty, and many leave their homesteads to explore the world. Now I do believe we keep a sample of a quarterling somewhere in the desk for you to see... Aha, here we go. Notice the honed physi- Oh, do step back, ladies, you're supposed to be wizards.

http://pre06.deviantart.net/6a5d/th/pre/...

Back in the cupboard with you... Now...

Where was I...?

Ah yes...

What you would think to be a terrible racial curse does have a few positives. Childbirth is very easy for the females, as is providing food for the child - very useful indeed as hobbits tend towards large families. That said, hobbits and their fractional offspring all have an acute, instinctive understanding that the slow shrinking of their race over time leaves them vulnerable to the threats of the world, ultimately even rats and other vermin.

The only way known to reverse this generational shrinkage is to incorporate "whole-ling" (human) blood into their offspring. This is to say that, by mating with a human, the progeny of such a union will always be one size larger. There is thus a natural urge of the hobbit or halfling to gravitate towards taller mates, in the same that humans gravitate towards healthy or beautiful ones... indeed, as demonstrated by my handsome little sample a moment ago.

While human-hobbit marriage is still quite rare, casual mating between the races is widespread and vital to their long-term survival. Hobbits have no taboo against it even if the hobbit in question is married, with cuckoldry seemingly viewed as normal. Do not be surprised or offended if propositioned in a hobbit-home. The couple are merely considering the best for their future children, and declining is considered impolite. Hobbit-husbands will happily sit and smoke their pipeweed while a human (or humans) goes about the business of impregnating their wife, and raise the resulting child exactly as they would their own.

When dealing with a hobbit or "-ling", be aware that their "interest" in a human is inversely proportionate to their size. Halflings may be very friendly and forward around a human, quarterlings will be extremely blunt about what they want, while eighthlings make the most adorable sexual predators.

Naturally this type of inter-racial pairing could be expected to create problems for the female halfling, both in the act itself and the delivery of offspring proportionately twice her size. Fortunately nature has deigned to grant her remarkable endurance and the ability to painlessly unhinge her hips, allowing for the ingress of the male phal- *ahem*... well that's a lesson for another time.
155332222222222222111123.title: Hobbits, halflings, quarterlings, and the rest

1553322222222222221111233.content:
Blorogons are a race of large four armed humanoids. Blorogons are naturally obese, but they are quite nimble despite their large size. Male Blorogons stand at an average of 10 feet tall and weigh at least 2000 lbs. Female Blorogons are two inches shorter than male Blorogons and weigh at least 100 lbs. less. Blorogons have four skin tones: Red, Blue, Yellow, and Green. Despite the main skin tones there have been findings that Offspring from two different colored Blorogons could create new skin tones. Blorogon culture is usually centered around festivities.

Blorogons are also skilled at reality bending magic. It is said if anyone transforms into a Blorogon will automatically have their history altered to where they were always a Blorogon. Besides reality manipulation Blorogons can control any element that matches their skin tone. People are not sure why that may be the case, but newer findings suggest that is more of a tribal thing than anything else. Blorogons usually live in the proximity of Erolus and Bishan. Blorogons are one of the many successful humanoid races in the world. Never tick one off because they will literally change your reality or worse. Despite their sucessful culture very few people outside of Bishan or Erolus know anything about them.
1553322222222222221111233.title: Blorogons

1553322222222222222.content:
Boggart
Take the form of its intended victim's worst, most horrific fear. An old wives' tale insists that sex with a boggart will cure anyone of fear. This is not true and is just unpleasant for all involved.

Catoplebas
An aggressive, magical monster that resembles a bull, covered in dusky, metal scales. It breathes a noxious cloud of fumes that will turn any creature to stone.

Pink Slime.
This ooze is formed of meat slurry. Pink slimes were developed by a group of orcs whom the dwarves commissioned to build them an anti-vorelf weapon. These slimes aggressively envelope whoever they come in contact with, sealing them inside their dripping bodies, but find dwarves repulsive and shy away. Vorelf shrinking saliva has no effect of a pink slime, and an imprisoned elf has no choice but to eat his or her way free. If this is even accomplished at all, it usually leaves the elf too engorged to seek other prey.

Spiders
Inject paralysing venom. Come in a variety of sizes (spiders the size of cats are not uncommon) and flavours.
Silk - spin webs of spider silk. Pretty generic.
Rubber - spray strands of sticky rubber. A popular familiar for Crimson wizards.
Drider - an elf fused to the body of an spider from the waist down. Was all the rage for a time in elven society. When having a spider for legs fell out of fashion, driders were driven out, along with flared trousers and pogs.

Skinsuits/living skin
Resembling the hollowed-out skin of a human or animal, skinsuits are imitative parasites that latch onto a host from which they draw their nutrients. These creatures hang from trees or lie in shallow water, waiting for an unsuspecting traveler to come close. Some have been seen to use their hollow bodies to float on gusts of wind.
Once they have ensnared and rapidly enveloped their prey, skinsuits are so painful to remove - akin to tearing off your own skin - that they can only be removed with outside help or with great strength of will. After a few hours, the parasite becomes fully fused to the skin of the host, and cannot be removed.
Days after becoming trapped inside the creature, the skinsuit sheds itself from the victim, as does a second skinsuit resembling the host's original form. In this way the skins reproduce themselves. The resulting two parasites go their own seperate ways, leaving the host trapped in the form of the original parasite, and severely weakened.
Neutered skinsuits (with the head having been severed) are incapable of fusing with a victim, and are sold for personal use, with a zipper sometimes added for ease of access.

Skinsect
